definition: to understand (on hearing)/to catch (what is spoken)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
to understand/to comprehend

sentences.english: If you want to walk out of here, you'll go through me, you got it?
sentences.chinese: 你若從這走出去，你我就此恩斷義絕，你聽懂了嗎？

sentences.english: Not only was she not talking but also she still understood only about four words.
sentences.chinese: 她不僅僅是不說話，她能聽懂的詞彙也只有四個。

sentences.english: Pretending to understand what you actually did not may just bring yourself embarrassment or even disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 沒有聽懂而假裝聽懂，可能會讓你尷尬甚至丟醜。

sentences.english: Pretending to understand what you actually did not may just bring yourself embarrassment or even disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 沒有聽懂而假裝聽懂，可能會讓你尷尬甚至丟醜。

sentences.english: He was fascinated, but 'only got half the jokes,' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他對此感到着迷，但只聽懂了一半的笑話。

sentences.english: The difficulty is how to make the Swede understand them.
sentences.chinese: 堅苦是如何讓那瑞典人聽懂她們的話。

sentences.english: Yes, I said what big nephew are willing to listen to, also can understand.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，我說什麼大侄兒都肯聽，也都能聽懂。

sentences.english: There was also a woodcutter, named Zhong Ziqi , who could understand his music.
sentences.chinese: 有個人叫鍾子期，能聽懂音樂。

sentences.english: Just to understand the story about his father, he has left us forever.
sentences.chinese: 剛能聽懂父親講的故事時，他卻永遠地離開了我們。

sentences.english: I don't think you heard me, missy .
sentences.chinese: 我想你沒聽懂我的意思，小姑娘。

sentences.english: We have never understood this sort of objections.
sentences.chinese: 我們從來就沒有聽懂過這類反對意見。

sentences.english: You should not expect to ever understand everything 100%.
sentences.chinese: 所以，不要指望100%地全部聽懂。

sentences.english: This will help you understand the next class.
sentences.chinese: 這將幫助你聽懂下堂課。

sentences.english: Mary was playing a joke on Ed, but Ed caught on.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗對艾得開玩笑，可是艾得聽懂了。

sentences.english: Each test item requires the test taker to understand a spoken utterance and speak in response to it.
sentences.chinese: 每個測試題都要求參試者聽懂一句話，然後給出回答。

sentences.english: I got what u said. I will talk with Wang to confirm that.
sentences.chinese: 其實不懂就說，不要說你聽懂了。

definition: unable to make sense of what one is hearing
to understand (by hearing)/to catch (what sb says)
to hear
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
Cantonese language
to speak out/to declare (one's view)

Chinese language (Mandarin), emphasizing its national nature/Chinese as a primary or secondary school subject/Chinese in the context of the Nationalist Government/Guoyu, book of historical narrative c. 10th-5th century BC
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
Cantonese language
dialogue (in a movie or a play)
can't hear
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
colloquial speech/spoken language/vernacular language/slander/gossip/CL:門|门[men2]
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
